channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-5591] Fabric git pushes rejected due to non fast forward
item.description:
In an installation where:

  • there are many containers, > 400,
  • alternating live and stage profile versions [see below for more detail]
  • more than one fabric-git version in play
    • 1.2.0.redhat-161
    • 1.2.0.redhat-165

It is often seen in the logs:

2016-04-21 10:59:18,877 | INFO | pool-36-thread-1 | io.fabric8.git.internal.DefaultPullPushPolicy | 69 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-161 |  -  -  |  -  -  | Performing a pull on remote URL: http://d154.mydomain.org:1234/git/fabric/
 
2016-04-21 10:59:26,199 | WARN | pool-36-thread-1 | io.fabric8.git.internal.DefaultPullPushPolicy | 69 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-161 |  -  -  |  -  -  | Pull failed because of: org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.TransportException: Read timed out after 5,000 ms
 
2016-04-21 10:59:26,858 | INFO | pool-36-thread-1 | io.fabric8.git.internal.DefaultPullPushPolicy | 69 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-161 |  -  -  |  -  -  | Performing a pull on remote URL: http://d154.mydomain.org:1234/git/fabric/
 
2016-04-21 10:59:33,782 | WARN | pool-36-thread-1 | io.fabric8.git.internal.DefaultPullPushPolicy | 69 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-161 |  -  -  |  -  -  | Pull failed because of: org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.TransportException: Read timed out after 5,000 ms
 
2016-04-21 10:59:46,963 | INFO | pool-36-thread-1 | io.fabric8.git.internal.DefaultPullPushPolicy | 69 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-161 |  -  -  |  -  -  | Performing a pull on remote URL: http://d154.sutterhealth.org:1234/git/fabric/

and infrequently seen:

run-em_p10.log:java.lang.IllegalStateException: Push rejected: [RemoteRefUpdate[remoteName=refs/heads/60.2, REJECTED_NONFASTFORWARD, (null)...bec7f3e3383f43c61d6f7f4ff1029ae2e5fa08a5, srcRef=refs/heads/60.2, message=null], RemoteRefUpdate[
 
remoteName=refs/heads/50.2, REJECTED_NONFASTFORWARD, (null)...592df1b0ea7a98e34aa22311e9ed10c67ef7fd4c, srcRef=refs/heads/50.2, message=null]]
 
run-em_p12.log:2016-05-10 07:56:38,168 | WARN | qtp1672381131-66692 | io.fabric8.git.internal.DefaultPullPushPolicy | 79 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-161 |  -  -  | Rejected push: {}RemoteRefUpdate[remoteName=refs/heads/60.1, REJ
 
ECTED_NONFASTFORWARD, (null)...f80d25ef779b93e3ab7f616da372a715e6403364, srcRef=refs/heads/60.1, message=null]

or

2016-05-13 12:16:15,720 | INFO | Thread-61794 | io.fabric8.git.internal.DefaultPullPushPolicy | 79 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-161 |  -  -  | Push result: [accepted=25,rejected=1,error=null]

Where the timeout had previously been increased to 15,000ms with no change in behaviour and the version strategy is to have 2 versions for each of the regions so that regions can be moved forward at their own pace and are not tied to another region. Then it alternates between the versions having 1 be a live version and the other a stage version for the next go-live update:

i.e.
10.1 - 10.2
11.1 - 11.2
20.1 - 20.2
30.1 - 30.2
40.1 - 40.2
50.1 - 50.2
60.1 - 60.2
70.1 - 70.2

As well rarely it has been seen:

2016-05-17 14:10:23,912 | WARN | pool-22-thread-1 | io.fabric8.service.ZkDataStoreImpl | 67 - io.fabric8.fabric-core - 1.2.0.redhat-153 |  -  -  |  -  -  | Caught: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot obtain profile read lock in time
 
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot obtain profile read lock in time
 
	at io.fabric8.api.gravia.IllegalStateAssertion.assertTrue(IllegalStateAssertion.java:55)[66:io.fabric8.fabric-api:1.2.0.redhat-133]
 
	at io.fabric8.git.internal.GitDataStoreImpl.aquireReadLock(GitDataStoreImpl.java:434)[69:io.fabric8.fabric-git:1.2.0.redhat-161]
 
	at io.fabric8.git.internal.GitDataStoreImpl.getVersionFromCacheRO(GitDataStoreImpl.java:485)[69:io.fabric8.fabric-git:1.2.0.redhat-161]
 
	at io.fabric8.git.internal.GitDataStoreImpl.getVersionFromCache(GitDataStoreImpl.java:477)[69:io.fabric8.fabric-git:1.2.0.redhat-161]
 
	at io.fabric8.git.internal.GitDataStoreImpl.getVersion(GitDataStoreImpl.java:642)[69:io.fabric8.fabric-git:1.2.0.redhat-161]
 
	at io.fabric8.internal.ProfileServiceImpl.getVersion(ProfileServiceImpl.java:126)[67:io.fabric8.fabric-core:1.2.0.redhat-153]
 
	at io.fabric8.internal.ContainerImpl.getVersion(ContainerImpl.java:203)[67:io.fabric8.fabric-core:1.2.0.redhat-153]
 
	at io.fabric8.internal.ContainerImpl.getContainerProfile(ContainerImpl.java:762)[67:io.fabric8.fabric-core:1.2.0.redhat-153]
 
	at io.fabric8.internal.ContainerImpl.getOverlayProfile(ContainerImpl.java:306)[67:io.fabric8.fabric-core:1.2.0.redhat-153]

The end resut of which is that the Fabric Git repository is "reverting" to previous values after updating profiles.
item.summary: Fabric git pushes rejected due to non fast forward

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Easy simulation and I have:

2016-06-08 09:24:21,427 | ERROR | l Console Thread | Console                          | 38 - org.apache.karaf.shell.console - 2.4.0.redhat-630077 | Exception caught while executing command
 
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Push rejected: [RemoteRefUpdate[remoteName=refs/heads/1.0, REJECTED_NONFASTFORWARD, (null)...538b1f7b2eff9f1c9847613370730b7cc48118d4, srcRef=refs/heads/1.0, message=null]]
 
	at io.fabric8.git.internal.GitDataStoreImpl.executeInternal(GitDataStoreImpl.java:1072)
 
	at io.fabric8.git.internal.GitDataStoreImpl.updateProfile(GitDataStoreImpl.java:749)
 
	at io.fabric8.git.internal.GitDataStoreImpl.updateProfile(GitDataStoreImpl.java:727)
 
	at io.fabric8.internal.ProfileServiceImpl.updateProfile(ProfileServiceImpl.java:152)
 
	at io.fabric8.internal.ProfileServiceImpl.updateProfile(ProfileServiceImpl.java:145)
 
	at io.fabric8.commands.ProfileEditAction.editProfile(ProfileEditAction.java:235)
 
	at io.fabric8.commands.ProfileEditAction.doExecute(ProfileEditAction.java:167)
 
	at org.apache.karaf.shell.console.AbstractAction.execute(AbstractAction.java:33)
 
	at org.apache.felix.gogo.commands.basic.AbstractCommand.execute(AbstractCommand.java:35)
 
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)[:1.8.0_92]
 
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)[:1.8.0_92]
 
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)[:1.8.0_92]
 
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)[:1.8.0_92]
 
	at org.apache.aries.proxy.impl.ProxyHandler$1.invoke(ProxyHandler.java:54)[19:org.apache.aries.proxy.impl:1.0.4]
 
	at org.apache.aries.proxy.impl.ProxyHandler.invoke(ProxyHandler.java:119)[19:org.apache.aries.proxy.impl:1.0.4]
 
	at io.fabric8.commands.$ProfileEdit250632023.execute(Unknown Source)[mvn:org.apache.aries.proxy/org.apache.aries.proxy.impl/1.0.4:]
 
	at org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime.CommandProxy.execute(CommandProxy.java:78)[38:org.apache.karaf.shell.console:2.4.0.redhat-630077]
 
	at org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime.Closure.executeCmd(Closure.java:477)[38:org.apache.karaf.shell.console:2.4.0.redhat-630077]
 
	at org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime.Closure.executeStatement(Closure.java:403)[38:org.apache.karaf.shell.console:2.4.0.redhat-630077]
 
	at org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime.Pipe.run(Pipe.java:108)[38:org.apache.karaf.shell.console:2.4.0.redhat-630077]
 
	at org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime.Closure.execute(Closure.java:183)[38:org.apache.karaf.shell.console:2.4.0.redhat-630077]
 
	at org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime.Closure.execute(Closure.java:120)[38:org.apache.karaf.shell.console:2.4.0.redhat-630077]
 
	at org.apache.felix.gogo.runtime.CommandSessionImpl.execute(CommandSessionImpl.java:92)[38:org.apache.karaf.shell.console:2.4.0.redhat-630077]
 
	at org.apache.karaf.shell.console.jline.Console.run(Console.java:197)[38:org.apache.karaf.shell.console:2.4.0.redhat-630077]
 
	at org.apache.karaf.shell.console.jline.DelayedStarted.run(DelayedStarted.java:79)[38:org.apache.karaf.shell.console:2.4.0.redhat-630077]
 
2016-06-08 09:24:22,145 | INFO  | admin-2-thread-1 | FabricConfigAdminBridge          | 176 - io.fabric8.fabric-configadmin - 1.2.0.redhat-630077 | Updating configuration io.fabric8.version

What I did?

  1. fresh Fuse
  2. fabric:create
  3. profile-edit --pid io.fabric8.version/a=1 default 1.0 (lead to push - works fine)
  4. externally from bash console I did: 

    $ cd data/git/local/fabric/
    		 
    $ cat >> fabric/profiles/default.profile/io.fabric8.version.properties
    		 
    y = 2
    		 
    ^D
    		 
    $ git commit -a -m 'My personal update of io.fabri8.version PID'
    		 
    [1.0 f4750e6] My personal update of io.fabri8.version PID
    		 
     1 file changed, 1 insertion(+)
    		 
    $ git push
    		 
    aCounting objects: 6, done.
    		 
    Delta compression using up to 4 threads.
    		 
    Compressing objects: 100% (4/4), done.
    		 
    Writing objects: 100% (6/6), 476 bytes | 0 bytes/s, done.
    		 
    Total 6 (delta 3), reused 0 (delta 0)
    		 
    remote: Resolving deltas: 100% (3/3)
    		 
    remote: Updating references: 100% (1/1)
    		 
    To http://everfree.forest:8181/git/fabric/
    		 
       89b41f4..f4750e6  1.0 -> 1.0

    the above didn't cause profile-display to show my new property in io.fabric8.version PID, because version/profile cache was not cleared.

  5. externally, I've cloned the main repo: 

    [ggrzybek@everfree] /data/servers/jboss-fuse-6.3.0.redhat-077/data/git 
    $ git clone servlet/fabric _local
    		 
    Cloning into '_local'...
    		 
    done.
    		 
    $ git checkout 1.0
    		 
    Branch 1.0 set up to track remote branch 1.0 from origin.
    		 
    Switched to a new branch '1.0'
    		 
    $ cat >> fabric/profiles/default.profile/io.fabric8.version.properties
    		 
    b=4
    		 
    $ git commit -a -m 'Change of version'
    		 
    [1.0 ba0bda1] Change of version
    		 
     1 file changed, 1 insertion(+)
    		 
    $ git push origin 1.0
    		 
    Counting objects: 6, done.
    		 
    Delta compression using up to 4 threads.
    		 
    Compressing objects: 100% (4/4), done.
    		 
    Writing objects: 100% (6/6), 452 bytes | 0 bytes/s, done.
    		 
    Total 6 (delta 3), reused 0 (delta 0)
    		 
    To /data/servers/jboss-fuse-6.3.0.redhat-077/data/git/servlet/fabric
    		 
       bc4ac5e..ba0bda1  1.0 -> 1.0

    This time profile-edit leads to REJECTED_NONFASTFORWARD, because upstream repo (data/git/servlet/fabric) is ahead of root's clone (data/git/local/fabric).

I'm checking why clone wasn't notified (via ZK) about change to upstream repo.
It worked when I cloned and pushed to http://localhost:8181/git/fabric instead of /data/servers/jboss-fuse-6.3.0.redhat-077/data/git/servlet/fabric...
I'd like to see result of this logging statement. please profile-edit --pid org.ops4j.pax.logging/log4j.logger.io.fabric8.git.internal=DEBUG karaf.

After increasing logging level, I saw:

2016-06-08 09:59:38,056 | DEBUG | it-ds-2-thread-1 | GitDataStoreImpl                 | 175 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-630077 | Watch counter updated to 9, doing a pull
 
2016-06-08 09:59:38,056 | INFO  | it-ds-2-thread-1 | DefaultPullPushPolicy            | 175 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-630077 | Performing a pull on remote URL: http://everfree.forest:8181/git/fabric/
 
2016-06-08 09:59:38,057 | DEBUG | it-ds-2-thread-1 | GitDataStoreImpl                 | 175 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-630077 | ProxySelector uri: http://everfree.forest:8181/git/fabric/info/refs?service=git-upload-pack -> [DIRECT]
 
2016-06-08 09:59:38,065 | DEBUG | it-ds-2-thread-1 | GitDataStoreImpl                 | 175 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-630077 | ProxySelector uri: http://everfree.forest:8181/git/fabric/info/refs?service=git-upload-pack -> [DIRECT]
 
2016-06-08 09:59:38,075 | DEBUG | it-ds-2-thread-1 | GitDataStoreImpl                 | 175 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-630077 | ProxySelector uri: http://everfree.forest:8181/git/fabric/git-upload-pack -> [DIRECT]
 
2016-06-08 09:59:38,236 | DEBUG | it-ds-2-thread-1 | GitDataStoreImpl                 | 175 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-630077 | ProxySelector uri: http://everfree.forest:8181/git/fabric/info/refs?service=git-upload-pack -> [DIRECT]
 
2016-06-08 09:59:38,237 | DEBUG | it-ds-2-thread-1 | GitDataStoreImpl                 | 175 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-630077 | ProxySelector uri: http://everfree.forest:8181/git/fabric/info/refs?service=git-upload-pack -> [DIRECT]
 
2016-06-08 09:59:38,240 | DEBUG | it-ds-2-thread-1 | DefaultPullPushPolicy            | 175 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-630077 | Processing remote branches: {patches-ssh-fabric8=Ref[refs/heads/patches-ssh-fabric8=a553cce1522d4f49e35305dc170c065aebfc7947], 1.0=Ref[refs/heads/1.0=1c42a4dfc3e58d00239a79f7a878c0953d7944c5], patches-root-amq=Ref[refs/heads/patches-root-amq=ba1b796e0df55fed3f6930f9231b90a7fbe2a33b], patches-root-fuse=Ref[refs/heads/patches-root-fuse=e000a2cfcfc545ed15f1bab8f9ee2bc6a0e0578a], patches-ssh-fuse=Ref[refs/heads/patches-ssh-fuse=ba1b796e0df55fed3f6930f9231b90a7fbe2a33b], patches-child=Ref[refs/heads/patches-child=ba1b796e0df55fed3f6930f9231b90a7fbe2a33b], master=Ref[refs/heads/master=2c40368544efb99ad3a7e6547537f90eb099fd1b]}
 
2016-06-08 09:59:38,340 | DEBUG | it-ds-2-thread-1 | DefaultPullPushPolicy            | 175 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-630077 | Updating local branch 1.0 with status: Fast-forward
 
2016-06-08 09:59:38,340 | INFO  | it-ds-2-thread-1 | DefaultPullPushPolicy            | 175 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-630077 | Pull result: [localUpdate=[1.0],remoteUpdate=false,versions=[1.0, master, patches-child, patches-root-amq, patches-root-fuse, patches-ssh-fabric8, patches-ssh-fuse],error=null]
 
2016-06-08 09:59:38,373 | DEBUG | store-2-thread-1 | GitHelpers                       | 175 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-630077 | Checked out branch master with results: OK
 
2016-06-08 09:59:38,477 | DEBUG | store-2-thread-1 | GitHelpers                       | 175 - io.fabric8.fabric-git - 1.2.0.redhat-630077 | Checked out branch 1.0 with results: OK
 
2016-06-08 09:59:38,958 | INFO  | admin-2-thread-1 | FabricConfigAdminBridge          | 176 - io.fabric8.fabric-configadmin - 1.2.0.redhat-630077 | Updating configuration io.fabric8.version

Watch counter updated to 9, doing a pull is logged at listener side, after fabric-git-server completes push operation and updates ZK shared count.

By design - if you push to git server provided by fabric-git-server bundle, there's ZK shared count increased, which triggers pull on each container connected to ensemble. If some containers fail to pull, there's no 2nd attempt.

I'm thinking on command that allows manual trigger of pull, but for now please increase git pull timeout:

profile-edit --pid io.fabric8.datastore/gitTimeout=30 default
